sens.mc: to show the existence or truth of by evidence
sens.vi: the prosecutor used DNA evidence to prove the defendant's guilt
sens.rel: back (up), buttress, circumstantiate, corroborate; evidence, evince, record, support, uphold, witness; adduce, attest, authenticate, certify, identify; confirm, sustain, verify, vouch; clinch, nail, settle; confess, depose, testify
sens.near: challenge, dispute, object; allege, assume, conjecture, guess, presume, surmise, suspect

sens.vi: the new automobile engine design proved impractical
sens.syn: fall out, pan out, prove, shake out, turn out
sens.rel: develop, emerge, evolve, germinate, play out, unfold, work out

sens.mc: to gain full recognition or acceptance of
sens.vi: proved herself a great actress on the Broadway stage
sens.rel: attest, authenticate, bear out, document, evidence, support, sustain, uphold; confirm, corroborate, justify, validate, verify
